title: Western Leaders Pledge Support for Ukraine ‘as Long as Necessary’
description: As Russia’s invasion approaches its second year with no end in sight, Ukraine’s supporters faced lingering questions at the Munich Security Conference about how long their resolve will last.

title: Macron Calls for Intensified Support for Ukraine but Eyes Peace Talks
description: His support for Ukraine and condemnation of Russia have hardened, but France’s president still stands out among Western leaders in insisting that compromise will be needed to end the war.

title: Militants Wage Deadly Battle in Karachi Police Headquarters
description: The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility for the assault, the latest in a string of attacks from the group that have shaken many Pakistanis’ sense of security in recent months.

title: Nicaragua Strips Citizenship From Hundreds Days After Prisoner Release
description: The country’s increasingly authoritarian government stripped more than 300 people of their citizenship, including political prisoners recently released and sent to the United States.

title: Rishi Sunak Pursues Deal on Northern Ireland
description: Amid political change in Scotland, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak went to Belfast to work on a trade agreement with the European Union.

title: Biden E.P.A. Reinstates Mercury Limits Weakened Under Trump
description: The moves sets the stage for the agency to issue tighter controls on mercury, a neurotoxin emitted by power plants.

title: Images Show Hidden Clues About Iran’s Significant Fighter Jet Upgrade
description: In early February, Iranian state media aired a video about an underground Air Force base. Details in the footage and satellite images point toward the possible arrival of advanced Russian jets.

title: At a security conference in Munich, Zelensky invokes the battle of David and Goliath.
U.S. and China Vie in Hazy Zone Where Balloons, U.F.O.s and Missiles Fly
description: American officials are worried China is far along in developing military technology that operates in the unregulated high-altitude zone of “near space.”

title: At Least 18 Migrants Found Dead in Truck in Bulgaria
description: More than 30 other people were taken to hospitals in the capital, Sofia.

title: New technology, same old blind spot?
description: Don’t just look at what technology can do, look at what it helps people do to each other.

title: Eileen Sheridan, Who Dominated Cycling in Postwar Britain, Dies at 99
description: Known as “the Mighty Atom,” she excelled at long-distance time trials and set several records that still stand more than 70 years later.

title: South Africa begins naval drills with Russia and China, despite criticism that it implies support of the war.
A Timeline of Nicola Bulley’s Disappearance
description: Nicola Bulley, a 45-year-old mother, was last seen on Jan. 27 outside a village in northwestern England. Her disappearance has led to national headlines and rampant speculation on social media.

title: Germany’s allies pushed Germany to send tanks to Ukraine. Now, Scholz is the one urging them.
description: At

title: Western officials hope to show unity. But that will be tested as the war drags on.
A Russian Mole in Germany Sows Suspicions at Home, and Beyond
description: A director at Germany’s spy service was picked up on suspicion of passing intelligence to Russia. German officials and allies worry just how deep the problem goes.

title: Ex-Worker at U.K. Embassy in Berlin Is Sentenced to 13 Years in Prison for Spying for Russia
description: The former security guard, who was caught in an undercover operation, had pleaded guilty to passing secret information to the Russian authorities.

title: Pandemic Closures, Unpatrolled Beach Visits Blamed for Spike in Drownings
description: The number of drownings nationwide last summer exceeded the 10-year average by 44 percent, while New South Wales is presently having “one of our worst summers on record.”

title: Pandemic Closures, Unpatrolled Beach Visits Blamed for Spike in Drownings
description: The number of drownings nationwide last summer exceeded the 10-year average by 44 percent, while New South Wales is presently having “one of our worst summers on record.”

title: Fox News for Universities
description: Conservatives are trying to do to higher education what they did to the news media and think tanks.

title: Ukraine’s Allies Are Determined to Show Unity at Munich Security Conference
description: Officials including Vice President Kamala Harris and Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken are convening for a three-day event that has taken on a quasi-official nature. Here’s what we’re covering today.

title: South Africa and Russia Are Old Friends. A War Isn’t Going to Change That.
description: South Africa starts 11 days of joint naval drills with Russia and China on Friday, despite criticism from American, European and even some South African officials that it looks like an endorsement of Russia’s Ukraine war.

title: Ukraine and Russia swap 202 prisoners, including soldiers who defended Mariupol.
‘Machismo Kills’: A Surge in Murders of Women Alarms Spain
description: The government is under pressure to combat gender violence after what authorities say were the killings of at least eight women this year by former or current partners.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Russian missiles on Ukraine.

title: Why Did a Turkish City Withstand the Quake When Others Crumbled?
description: Erzin survived last week’s 7.8-magnitude quake with no casualties and little damage. The mayor credited his enforcement of building standards, but scientists say it is likely be more about geology.

title: How a Tiny NATO Nation Tackled a Big Problem: Arming Ukraine
description: Luxembourg’s challenges in buying arms on the open market underscore the struggle to keep Ukraine supplied until sophisticated Western weapons arrive in the spring.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With New Missile Barrage
description: In a blend of the old school and the new, Moscow sent balloons over Ukraine before pummeling it with high-tech weaponry.
